UINT32 AudioUtility::CalculatePlayTime (  BinData *  bin_data,
MimeType  mime_type
)  [static]
 

Calculates the playtime of audio data

Parameters:
bin_data Audio data
mime_type Mime type of the audio data
Returns:
UINT32 Playtime in milliseconds, 0 if unsuccessfull
Note:
Curently it supports AMR and WAVE formats

BOOLEAN AudioUtility::FindAudioDataOffset (  const UINT8 *  buffer,
const UINT32  bufferSize,
const AudioDataType  audioDataType,
UINT32 &  offset
)  [static]
 

Finds an offset for the given audio data type, i.e. beginning of the first frame.

Parameters:
buffer The pointer to the input data.
bufferSize The size of the input buffer.
audioDataType The audio data type.
offset Offset, relative to the input buffer, the result, number of bytes.
Returns:
BOOLEAN True on success, zero otherwise.

const AudioDataType  audioDataType,
UINT32 &  offset
)  [static]
 

Finds an offset for the given audio data type, i.e. beginning of the first frame.

Parameters:
path The path of the file that should be checked.
audioDataType The audio data type.
offset Offset, relative to the input buffer, the result, number of bytes.
Returns:
BOOLEAN True on success, zero otherwise.

UINT16 AudioUtility::GetCallVolume (  const UINT16 &  volume  )  [static]
 

Check if there is an ongoing call and adjust the volume

Parameters:
volume Volume intensity
volumeMin Min Volume intensity
volumeMax Max Volume intensity
Returns:
UINT16 The volume to be used during an active call.
Note:
If speech channel is open, the volume level will be limited as follows: The value for the volume will be calculated as the percentage of the speech volume. If the given volume is less than the calculated volume the same volume that was passed in the parameter will be returned, otherwise the calculated value. If speech channel is closed the same value that was passed in the parameter will be returned.

BOOLEAN AudioUtility::GetNumbersOfFrames (  const UINT8 *  buffer,
const UINT32  bufferSize,
const AudioDataType  audioDataType,
const UINT32  offset,
UINT32 &  numberOfFrames
)  [static]
 

Finds the number of frames for the given audio record.

Parameters:
buffer Input record buffer that should be scaned.
buffer_size The size of the input record, i.e. buffer.
audioDataType The audio data type.
offset Offset, relative to the input record, number of bytes.
numberOfFrames Result value, number of frames.
Returns:
BOOLEAN True on success, zero otherwise.

UINT32 AudioUtility::GetUint32FromUint8Array (  const UINT8 *  data  )  [static]
 

BOOLEAN AudioUtility::ValidateAudioData (  const Path &  path,
const AudioDataType  audioDataType
)  [static]
 

Checks the input file format.

Parameters:
path The path of the file that should be checked.
fileType The audio data that should be checked. If AudioDataTypeUnknown is given, type will be extracted from MIME type of the file.
Returns:
BOOLEAN FALSE if the header data is corrupted.
Note:
This function currently checks only the header data for following audio file formats: MIDI, SMAF, SMAF Phrase and IMelody. It returns false only if header data is corrupted. For any other sound format function allways returns TRUE.

BOOLEAN AudioUtility::ValidateAudioData (  const UINT8 *  buffer,
const AudioDataType  audioDataType
)  [static]
 

Checks the format of the sound in the buffer.

Parameters:
buffer The pointer to the buffer that should be checked.
fileType The audio data type that should be checked.
Returns:
BOOLEAN FALSE if the header data is corrupted.
Note:
This function currently checks only the header data for following audio formats: MIDI, SMAF, SMAF Phrase and IMelody. It returns FALSE only if header data is corrupted. For any other sound format function allways returns TRUE.
